templates.title: Cloud Commander
templates.description: Cloud Commander is a file manager. It includes a command-line console and a text editor. Cloud Commander helps you work with files and directories.
templates.note: Deploys Cloud Commander. Docs

env.name: PASSWORD
env.label: Password
env.description: Password for the web UI user

env.name: BASE_DIR
env.label: URL base path
env.description: Base URL path when served behind a reverse proxy (e.g., /cloudcmd). Use / for root.

templates.title: Duplicati
templates.description: Duplicati is a backup client that securely stores encrypted, incremental, compressed backups on cloud storage services and remote file servers.
templates.note: Deploys Duplicati. Docs

templates.title: FTP/FTPS Server
templates.description: Flexible FTP/FTPS server based on vsftpd (delfer/alpine-ftp-server).
templates.note:
Deploys FTP server with passive mode.

FTPS:
  - To enable TLS, specify a valid NPM directory name for the certificate and key (see the guide in our knowledge base).
  - Without them, server runs in plain FTP mode.

Docs

env.name: NPM_PROXY_HOST_CERT_DIR
env.label: NPM Proxy host
env.description: NPM Directory containing TLS certificate files

templates.title: Gatus
templates.description: Create automated status pages with real-time uptime monitoring. Detect website and API downtime before your users do.
templates.note: Gatus is a developer-oriented health dashboard that gives you the ability to monitor your services using HTTP, ICMP, TCP, and even DNS queries as well as evaluate the result of said queries by using a list of conditions on values like the status code, the response time, the certificate expiration, the body and many others. The icing on top is that each of these health checks can be paired with alerting via Slack, Teams, PagerDuty, Discord, Twilio and many more.. Docs

templates.title: Ghost CMS
templates.description: Modern publishing platform (requires MySQL database).
templates.note: Deploys Ghost CMS. Requires external MySQL database. Create database and user before deployment. Docs

env.name: DB_PASSWORD
env.label: Database User Password
env.description: MySQL database user password (must contains word and numbers)

env.name: GHOST_URL
env.label: Ghost URL
env.description: Full URL where Ghost will be accessible (e.g., https://blog.yourdomain.com)

templates.title: Mailu
templates.description: Mailu is a simple yet full-featured mail server with Antispam and Antivirus system.
templates.note: You can find all configuration docks by this link -> Docs

env.name: HOSTNAMES
env.label: Hostnames for this server, separated with commas

env.name: POSTMASTER
env.label: Postmaster local part (will append the main mail domain, example admin@test.com)

env.name: SECRET_KEY
env.label: Set to a randomly generated 16 bytes string (openssl rand -hex 16)

env.name: TLS_FLAVOR
env.label: Choose how secure connections will behave (value: letsencrypt, cert, notls)

env.name: FRONT_ADDRESS
env.label: Choose how secure connections will behave for webmail

env.name: WEBROOT_REDIRECT
env.label: Choose how secure connections will behave (value: none, yes)

env.name: DISABLE_STATISTICS
env.label: Opt-out of statistics, replace with True to opt out

env.name: ADMIN
env.label: Expose the admin interface (value: true, false)
env.description: The admin interface is the main Mailu-specific bit, it provides tools to manage your email domains, users, etc.

env.name: API
env.label: Expose the API interface (value: true, false)
env.description: The API interface is a RESTful API for changing the Mailu configuration. Anything that can be configured via the Mailu web administration interface, can also be configured via the RESTful API. For enabling the API, an API token must be configured. It is not possible to use the API without an API token.

env.name: ANTIVIRUS
env.label: Antivirus solution (value: clamav, none).
env.description: An antivirus server helps fighting large scale virus spreading campaigns that leverage e-mail for initial infection. Make sure that you have at least 1GB of memory for ClamAV to load its signature database.

env.name: WEBMAIL
env.label: Choose which webmail to run if any (values: roundcube, snappymail, none).

env.name: MESSAGE_SIZE_LIMIT
env.label: Message size limit in bytes (Default: accept messages up to 50MB)

env.name: MESSAGE_RATELIMIT
env.label: Message rate limit (per user in one day)

env.name: DEFAULT_SPAM_THRESHOLD
env.label: Default spam threshold used for new users

env.name: AUTH_RATELIMIT_IP
env.label: Authentication rate limit per IP (per /24 on ipv4 and /48 on ipv6)

env.name: AUTH_RATELIMIT_USER
env.label: Authentication rate limit per user (regardless of the source-IP)

env.name: WEB_API
env.label: Path to the API interface if enabled

env.name: CREDENTIAL_ROUNDS
env.label: Number of rounds used by the password hashing scheme

templates.title: MariaDB with phpMyAdmin
templates.description: MariaDB database server with phpMyAdmin web interface
templates.note: Deploys MariaDB with phpMyAdmin on port 8080. Set MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD environment variable. MariaDB is only accessible via 'databases' network.

env.name: MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD
env.label: MySQL Root Password
env.description: Password for the MariaDB root user

templates.description: High-performance object storage server compatible with Amazon S3 API.
templates.note: Deploys Minio S3-compatible object storage. API on port 9000, Console on port 9001. Docs

env.name: MINIO_ROOT_PASSWORD
env.label: Minio Root Password

templates.title: MongoDB with Mongo Express
templates.description: MongoDB database server with Mongo Express web interface
templates.note: Deploys MongoDB with Mongo Express web interface. Set MONGO_ROOT_PASSWORD environment variable. MongoDB is only accessible via 'databases' network

env.name: MONGO_ROOT_PASSWORD
env.label: MongoDB Root Password
env.description: Password for the MongoDB root user

env.name: ME_CONFIG_BASICAUTH_USERNAME
env.label: mongo-express login user
env.description: Username for logging into the MongoDB management

env.name: ME_CONFIG_BASICAUTH_PASSWORD
env.label: mongo-express login password
env.description: Password for logging into the MongoDB management

templates.title: n8n
templates.description: n8n - Flexible AI workflow automation for technical teams
templates.note:
Deploys n8n. Docs

Requirements:
  - Existing PostgreSQL database server reachable on the databases network.
  - Admin credentials are used ONCE by db-init to create the role/DB if missing and to grant privileges (idempotent).
Encryption key:
  - Purpose: encrypts credentials/secrets at rest, keep it private. Changing it later will make existing credentials unreadable.
  - Paste the generated Base64 string as the value of Encryption key (recommended length: 48 bytes => ~64 Base64 chars).
  - Generate on Linux/macOS: openssl rand -base64 48
  - Online generator (use at your own risk, offline generation is recommended): terrific.tools — OpenSSL Password Generator

env.name: DOMAIN_NAME
env.label: Public domain
env.description: Public hostname for n8n (no path). Example: n8n.example.com

env.name: N8N_ENCRYPTION_KEY
env.label: Encryption key
env.description: Long random secret for encrypting credentials (required). Example: openssl rand -base64 48

env.name: POSTGRES_DB
env.label: Database name
env.description: Target n8n database. Will be created by db-init if missing.

env.name: POSTGRES_USER
env.label: n8n DB user
env.description: Database user for n8n. Will be created by db-init if missing.

env.name: POSTGRES_PASSWORD
env.label: n8n DB password
env.description: Password of the n8n DB user (used by n8n and created by db-init if missing)

env.name: POSTGRES_ADMIN_USER
env.label: PostgreSQL admin user (bootstrap)
env.description: Superuser or a role with CREATE ROLE/CREATE DB/GRANT to bootstrap once

env.name: POSTGRES_ADMIN_PASSWORD
env.label: PostgreSQL admin password (bootstrap)
env.description: Admin password used ONLY by db-init to bootstrap (n8n itself will NOT use it)

env.name: POSTGRES_HOST
env.label: PostgreSQL host
env.description: DNS name/alias of the existing PostgreSQL within the external 'databases' network

env.name: N8N_PROTOCOL
env.label: Public protocol
env.description: https or http. If http, consider N8N_SECURE_COOKIE=false (see note).

templates.title: NetData
templates.description: Netdata is an open-source, real-time infrastructure monitoring platform. Monitor, detect, and act across your entire infrastructure.
templates.note: Netdata is the most energy-efficient tool for monitoring Docker-based systems. The study also shows Netdata excels in CPU usage, RAM usage, and execution time compared to other monitoring solutions. Docs

templates.title: Nginx Proxy Manager
templates.description: Expose your services to your domain
templates.note: Allows to open web serices to external ports. Docs

env.name: INITIAL_ADMIN_EMAIL
env.label: Initial login email
env.description: Email to use during first setup

env.name: INITIAL_ADMIN_PASSWORD
env.label: Initial login password
env.description: Password to use during first setup

templates.title: Odoo
templates.description: Open-source suite of business management software tools, often referred to as an ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system. It provides a wide range of integrated applications to manage various business processes, such as accounting, inventory, sales, customer relationship management (CRM), human resources, manufacturing, e-commerce, and more. Odoo is highly customizable, modular, and designed to be flexible for businesses of all sizes, from small startups to large enterprises.
templates.note: Default login credentials: user - admin , password - admin . Also you can read official documentation if you want some custom twiks

templates.title: Ollama AI
templates.description: Ollama is a tool and runtime for running large language models (LLMs) locally on your own server.
templates.note:
Usage:
  - Choose a model to pre-pull on deploy (or specify a custom tag).
  - Models catalog: ollama.com/library

CPU-only:
  - Works out of the box. No extra settings needed.

GPU (NVIDIA):
  - Ensure NVIDIA drivers + nvidia-container-toolkit are installed on the host.
  - Then add GPU flags to the service (see compose comment in the stack for an example).

n8n:
  - Point your n8n agent/tools to the Ollama API at http://ollama:11434 (or via your reverse proxy).

env.name: OLLAMA_MODEL_PRESET
env.label: Model (preset)
env.description: Select a model to pre-pull on deploy. For more models see: https://ollama.com/library

env.name: OLLAMA_MODEL_CUSTOM
env.label: Custom model tag (optional)
env.description: If preset is 'Custom', put a full tag here (e.g., 'llava:13b' or 'gemma:2b-instruct'). See: https://ollama.com/library

templates.title: OpenProject
templates.description: Use OpenProject to manage your projects, tasks and goals.
templates.note: Default login credentials: user - admin , password - admin . Also you can read official documentation if you want some custom twiks

templates.title: Supabase
templates.description: The Postgres development platform. Supabase gives you a dedicated Postgres database to build your web, mobile, and AI applications.
templates.note: Deploys with your own variables. You can see what variable do in this Docs

env.name: JWT_SECRET
env.label: You need to generate secure keys for accessing your services (See Docs)
env.description: You need to generate secure keys for accessing your services. We'll use the JWT Secret to generate anon and service API keys using the form from Docs.

env.name: ANON_KEY
env.label: You need to generate secure keys for accessing your services (See Docs)
env.description: You need to generate secure keys for accessing your services. We'll use the JWT Secret to generate anon and service API keys using the form from Docs.

env.name: SERVICE_ROLE_KEY
env.label: You need to generate secure keys for accessing your services (See Docs)
env.description: You need to generate secure keys for accessing your services. We'll use the JWT Secret to generate anon and service API keys using the form from Docs.

env.name: DASHBOARD_USERNAME
env.label: Dashboard Basic Auth Username
env.description: The Dashboard is protected with basic authentication. The default user and password MUST be updated before using Supabase in production.

env.name: DASHBOARD_PASSWORD
env.label: Dashboard Basic Auth Password
env.description: The Dashboard is protected with basic authentication. The default user and password MUST be updated before using Supabase in production.

env.name: SECRET_KEY_BASE
env.label: Phoenix secure key. It should look like a long base64-encoded string (openssl rand -base64 64)
env.description: SECRET_KEY_BASE is required for Phoenix to work securely.

env.name: VAULT_ENC_KEY
env.label: Encription Key for your Vault like HashiCorp,Secrets Manager by AWS, etc.
env.description: Many components inside Supabase use secure secrets and passwords. These are Vault Key to connect to vault like HashiCorp,Secrets Manager by AWS, etc.

env.name: POOLER_DEFAULT_POOL_SIZE
env.label: Default number of connections per pool
env.description: Default number of connections per pool

env.name: POOLER_MAX_CLIENT_CONN
env.label: Max Client Connections
env.description: Maximum number of client connections allowed

env.name: PGRST_DB_SCHEMAS
env.label: PostgREST DB Schemas
env.description: Comma-separated list of DB schemas used by PostgREST

env.name: ADDITIONAL_REDIRECT_URLS
env.label: Additional Redirect URLs
env.description: Extra URLs for redirection during auth flows

env.name: API_EXTERNAL_URL
env.label: API External URL
env.description: Base URL of the external API

env.name: ENABLE_EMAIL_SIGNUP
env.label: Enable Email Signup
env.description: Allow users to sign up using email

env.name: SMTP_ADMIN_EMAIL
env.label: SMTP Admin Email
env.description: Email address of the SMTP admin

env.name: SMTP_SENDER_NAME
env.label: SMTP Sender Name
env.description: Name shown as sender in emails

env.name: ENABLE_PHONE_SIGNUP
env.label: Enable Phone Signup
env.description: Allow users to sign up using phone numbers

env.name: IMGPROXY_ENABLE_WEBP_DETECTION
env.label: Enable WebP Detection
env.description: Detect and serve WebP images if supported

env.name: OPENAI_API_KEY
env.label: OpenAI API Key
env.description: API key used for OpenAI integration

env.name: FUNCTIONS_VERIFY_JWT
env.label: Verify JWT in Functions
env.description: Enable JWT verification in Supabase functions

env.name: GOOGLE_PROJECT_ID
env.label: Google Project ID
env.description: ID of the Google Cloud project

env.name: GOOGLE_PROJECT_NUMBER
env.label: Google Project Number
env.description: Number of the Google Cloud project
